indications:
Indications 
(From Disulfiram: British National Formulary)
Disulfiram
name: DISULFIRAM
cautions:
Cautions ensure that alcohol not consumed for at least 24 hours before initiating treatment; see also notes above; alcohol challenge not recommended on routine basis (if considered essential—specialist units only with resuscitation
facilities); respiratory disease, diabetes mellitus, epilepsy; avoid in acute porphyria (section 9.8.2); interactions: Appendix 1 (disulfiram)
side-effects:
Side-effects initially drowsiness and fatigue; nausea, vomiting,
halitosis, reduced libido; rarely psychotic reactions
(depression, paranoia, schizophrenia, mania), allergic dermatitis,
peripheral neuritis, hepatic cell damage
doses:
200 mg daily increased if necessary; usual max. 500 mg
daily; child not recommended
pregnancy:
Pregnancy high concentrations of acetaldehyde which occur in
presence of alcohol may be teratogenic; avoid in
first trimester
